Â Hey Michael,
My home language is Afrikaans, I was educated in English up to my engineering degree and I lived in Germany for a year. Although my German is incredibly rusty, I do dream in all three languages and it is entirely situation dependent. Even my conscience is multilingual on the situation. For example, there are certain phone numbers I can only recite in Afrikaans, others in English and a select few in German. It's messed up, but that's just how it is.
The fascinating part is that you Reach a point where you no longer translate the language into your own, you simply understand it. For example: writing this paragraph is simply me writing it as I think it, I haven't even thought of what it would sound like in my home language.
If you want to learn a language, learn the humour that goes with it. It will give you a perception of the language which you simply cannot learn from books.
I wouldn't consider myself more intelligent than others, it's simply ONE of many areas where people's brains can excel/fall behind. Don't ask me to cook or draw. I'll Burn water and I almost flunk elementary school because I kept colouring in over the lines. :/
